title: Brief Remarks on the U.S. Economy
content: - 2 -   quarter-point increase in short-term interest rates.  These rates remain low, and my   colleagues and I believe that this gradual return to normal is helping to sustain this strong   economy for the longer-run benefit of all Americans.   As I mentioned, 10 years have now passed since the depths of the financial   crisis--a painful part of our history that cost many Americans their jobs, their homes, and,   for some, their hopes and dreams.  In addition to holding interest rates low to support the   recovery, we have taken many steps to make the financial system safer.  In particular, we   are holding the largest banks to much higher standards in the amount of capital and   liquidity they hold and in the ways they assess and manage the risks they take.  I am   confident that the system today is stronger and in a far better position to support the   financial needs of households and businesses through good times and bad.  We continue   to work to sustain these fundamental improvements while also ensuring that regulation is   both effective and efficient.   Thank you.  I am happy to take your questions.
